TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {68345=at Harvard 2013: Named the 140th captain of Harvard football by his teammates ... Selected to College Sports Madness Preseason All-Ivy League second team ... Tabbed to Phil Steele Preseason All-Ivy League first team ... Selected unanimously to the All-Ivy League first team ... Named to College Sports Madness All-Ivy first team ... Honored on FCS All-New England team ... Named to NFF Hampshire Honor Society ... Started all 10 games ... Ranked four on the team with 50 tackles ... Amassed 4.0 tackles for a loss and 2.5 sacks ... Broke up five passes on the year ... Forced a fumble, broke up a pass and finished with five tackles at San Diego ... Had two tackles against Brown ... Broke up a pass, had 0.5 sacks and three tackles at Holy Cross ... Made six stops at Cornell ... Had a sack for an eight-yard loss and finished with seven tackles against Lafayette ... Recorded 10 stops, including 1.0 for a loss, against Princeton ... Made 1.5 tackles for a loss, including a sack, and broke up a pass against Dartmouth ... Broke up a pass and made two tackles at Columbia ... Led Harvard with eight tackles and had an interception against Penn ... Tabbed Ivy Co-Defensive Player of the Week Nov. 18 ... Finished with three tackles at Yale. 2012: Unanimous choice All New-England by the New England Football Writers Association ... Unanimous first team All-Ivy League at linebacker ...  Second team All-Ivy League by CollegeSportsMadness.com ... Preseason second team All-Ivy League byPhil Steel’s College Football Preview ... Third team All-Ivy League by College Sports Madness ... Had 10 tackles against San Diego ... Forced a fumble at Brown ... Ivy League Honor Roll with nine tackles, a sack, forced fumble and a recovery, one breakup and three QB hurries against Cornell ... Had seven tackles and a sack at Dartmouth ... Team-high nine tackles at Penn with eight solo efforts and two tackles for a loss ... Team-high 10 tackles in a win over Yale. 2011: Major H recipient ... All-Ivy League Honorable Mention ... Placed second on the team in tackles with 64 despite only starting five games ... Had 11 tackles (five solo) and a forced fumble in a win against Brown ... Had eight tackles against Lafayette ... Had a team-high eight tackles in a win at Cornell ... Ivy League Honor Roll on Oct. 24 after a career-high 17 tackles and a fumble recovery against Princeton.  2010: Appeared in all 10 games and finished with 21 total tackles while establishing himself as one of the up-and-coming linebackers in the Ivy ... Had a sack and three tackles in a win at Lafayette in his first career start at linebacker ... Had eight tackles and a sack against Cornell ... Had three solo tackles and an interception return for 45 yards at Dartmouth ... Major H award winner. 2009: Appeared in two games, against Brown and at Yale, collecting a tackle against the Bulldogs in a season shortened by injury ...
